name: heat and power co-generation unit construction, organic Rankine cycle, 3MW electrical | heat and power co-generation unit, organic Rankine cycle, 3MW electrical | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6662/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a binary cycle Organic Rankine Cycle unit with a capacity of 3 MWel and 30 MWth, inteded to be used in a geothermal Hot-Dry-Rock power plant. ;In general, ORC units produce energy at low temperature (differences) and pressure by vapourizing an organic working fluid in the heat exchanger with the organic substance having a low boiling point and a high vapor pressure. Geothermal fluid inlet temperatures often range between 50-150째C and therefore do not provide enough steam to produce electric energy. The heat is transferred to a secondary (organic) working fluid, which is used in a cycle with nearly no losses. Only the working fluid comes into contact with the mechanical parts of the plants, but not the geothermal fluid itself, which extends the lifetime of those parts. In this dataset, perfluoropentane is chosen as working fluid.;;The masses of different materials are based on data for a 1 MWel ORC unit in (Rogge 2004 - details on source see exchanges) and a 6.4 MWth ORC unit in (Bauer 2007). The dataset is mainly based on the 6.4 MWth unit and was adapted with the 1MWel unit for geothermal use.  ;Source of the image: Koehler, S. and Saadat, A. 2003. Thermodynamic Modeling of Binary Cycles. Looking for Best Case Scenarios. International Geothermal Conference, Reykjavik, September 2003. Session #1. ;Scheme of a possible organic rankine cycle unit architecture.;;1 Regenerator;2 Condenser;3 Turbine;4 electric generator;5 circulating pump;6 recuperator;7 evaporator;8 feed line district heat;9 return line distric heat;10 feed line thermic oil;11 return line thermic oil;Source of the image: Uni Bayreuth. Multitalent Organic Rankine Cycle. Stromerzeugung aus Abw채rme und regenerativen Energien. Lehrstuhl f체r technische Thermodynamik und Transportprozesse. Prof. Dr.-Ing. Dieter Br체ggemann. 

This dataset starts from the purchase of materials and energy needed to build the ORC unit. 

This activity ends with the constructed ORC unit.

This dataset includes 
 - materials and energy inputs
 - decommissioning
 - the building for the ORC unit
The unit includes an electricity generator, turbines, a compressor, a condenser, tubes and pipes for working fluid distribution within the cycle. 

 The dataset doesnt include the basement in concrete for the installation. 
This dataset doesn't include 
 - land use. This should be included in the datasets the ORC unit is used in. 
 - any anticorrosive coating of the different parts of the ORC unit.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: ORC unit with a capacity of 3 MWel and 30 MWth. Perfluoropentane is used as circuit medium.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolations from a 1 MWel ORC unit and a 6.4 MWth ORC unit to a 3MWel/30MWth ORC unit. The two main sources are from 2004 (Rogge) and 2007 (Bauer et al.), whereas Bauer et al. rely on values of an older report from 2001.

flow.name: heat and power co-generation unit, organic Rankine cycle, 3MW electrical
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. The original value of 2400 kWh electricity was extrapolated with a factor 5 (see parameters).

Assumption: This amount of electricity use includes the energy for demolition, too. Material processing is considered seperately.

exchanges.description: Estimation/calculated value. The total needed area of the building (500m2) is divided by 3 (60 years lifetime of the building divided by the lifetime of the ORC unit (20 years)) in order to standardize this exchange to 20 years.

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value/estimation. According to (Rogge 2004), Perfluorpentan (C5F12) is used as working fluid. Its amount as well as the steel mass is estimated by upscaling the requirements in (Rogge 2004) by a factor of 2.5 (see parameters)

defaultProvider.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. The amount of the steel mass is estimated by upscaling the requirements in (Rogge 2004) by a factor of 2.5 (see parameters). 

Weights of the different ORC components:
 - evaporator: 11t
 - boiler: 4t
 - turbine: 3t
 - generator: 4t
 - pump of working fluid: 1t
 - condensator of the organic circulating fluid: 16t.
